title: Verve Jazz Masters 21 - George Benson (1994) [Jazz][mp3 320][h33
description:
Verve Jazz Masters 21 - George Benson
Audio CD (October 4, 1994) 
Original Release Date: 1968 
Label: Polygram Records 
Bitrate: 320 kbps

This is a more satisfactory summary of George Benson's late-'60s recordings than the early CD era's Silver Collection because it includes a pair of the later A&M recordings and a couple of guest spots on a Jimmy Smith album from that period.  At this time, Benson, still in his mid-20s, was solidifying his reputation as a tremendously fluent and powerful guitar soloist, with plenty of hard bop facility and a genuine taste for R&B riffing and swinging.  The eloquent slow blues of "Low Down and Dirty," and the wild, weird use of a Varitone octave multiplier on "The Shape of Things to Come," and the gutsy if occasionally scattered bop licks as a foil for the smoldering Smith (with drummer Donald Bailey) on "The Boss" go a long way toward illustrating Benson's range here. ~ Richard S. Ginell, All Music Guide

This is a wonderful compilation of some of Benson's best earlier recordings.  All of these tracks were recorded in 1968 and 1969 and includes a wonderful vocal "Out of the Blue" and an excellent Beatles medley, "Something/Octopus's Garden".  Benson is one of those great artists who is equally at home in the pop field, as well as being a very talented jazz musician.  This is an excellent introductory album for anyone who is not that familiar with Benson.  And it is practically a guarantee that you'll want to hear more of his music after hearing this.  The booklet contains liner notes on the songs and Benson. ~ G. Sawaged
